step.para: Ensure JBoss Developer Studio is not running.
On the command line, navigate to the location of the JBoss Developer Studio installation and move into the Uninstaller directory.

On the command line, enter java -jar uninstaller.jar
Alternatively, to start the uninstaller you may be able to double-click the uninstaller.jar file.
Select Force the deletion if you want to remove the whole of the directory. If this is not selected, JBoss Developer Studio is uninstalled but files are left behind in the installation directory.
Once the progress bar shows Finished, click Quit to close the Uninstaller window.
